classes.name: CommandoClient
classes.description: Discord.js Client with a command framework

props.name: registry
props.description: The client's command registry

props.name: dispatcher
props.description: The client's command dispatcher

props.name: commandPrefix
props.description: The global command prefix - modifying this will emit {@link CommandoClient#commandPrefixChange}.

events.name: commandBlocked
events.description: Emitted when a command is prevented from running

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from

params.name: reason
params.description: Reason that the command was blocked

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: fromPattern
params.description: Whether the args are pattern matches (see {@link Command#run})

events.name: commandError
events.description: Emitted when a command produces an error while running

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that the command is running from (see {@link Command#run})

params.name: fromPattern
params.description: Whether the args are pattern matches (see {@link Command#run})

events.name: unknownCommand
events.description: Emitted when an unknown command is triggered

params.name: message
params.description: Command message that triggered the command

events.name: groupRegister
events.description: Emitted when a group is registered

params.name: registry
params.description: Registry that the group was registered to

events.name: commandRegister
events.description: Emitted when a command is registered

params.name: registry
params.description: Registry that the command was registered to

events.name: commandReregister
events.description: Emitted when a command is reregistered

events.name: commandUnregister
events.description: Emitted when a command is unregistered

events.name: commandPrefixChange
events.description: Emitted whenever a guild's command prefix is changed

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild that the prefix was changed in (null for global)

events.name: commandStatusChange
events.description: Emitted whenever a command is enabled/disabled in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild that the command was enabled/disabled in (null for global)

events.name: groupStatusChange
events.description: Emitted whenever a command group is enabled/disabled in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild that the group was enabled/disabled in (null for global)

classes.name: CommandArgument
classes.description: A fancy argument for a command

props.name: command
props.description: Command the argument is for

props.name: key
props.description: Key for the argument

props.name: label
props.description: Label for the argument

props.name: prompt
props.description: Question prompt for the argument

props.name: type
props.description: Type of the argument ('string', 'integer', 'float', 'boolean', 'user', 'member', 'role', 'channel', or 'message')

props.name: max
props.description: If type is 'integer' or 'float', this is the maximum value of the number.If type is 'string', this is the maximum length of the string.

props.name: min
props.description: If type is 'integer' or 'float', this is the minimum value of the number.If type is 'string', this is the minimum length of the string.

props.name: default
props.description: The default value for the argument

props.name: infinite
props.description: Whether the argument accepts an infinite number of values

props.name: validator
props.description: Validator function for validating a value for the argument

props.name: parser
props.description: Parser function for parsing a value for the argument

props.name: wait
props.description: How long to wait for input (in seconds)

methods.name: obtain
methods.description: Prompts the user and obtains the value for the argument

methods.name: obtainInfinite
methods.description: Prompts the user and obtains multiple values for the argument

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Checks if a value is valid for the argument

methods.name: parse
methods.description: Parses a value string into a proper value for the argument

methods.name: validateString
methods.description: Checks if a string is not empty, and is within the min and max limits, if set

methods.name: validateInteger
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as an integer, and is within the min and max limits, if set

methods.name: validateFloat
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as a float, and is within the min and max limits, if set

methods.name: validateBoolean
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as a boolean

methods.name: parseBoolean
methods.description: Parses a boolean out of a string

methods.name: validateUser
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as a User object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: parseUser
methods.description: Parses a string into a User object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: validateMember
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as a GuildMember object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: parseMember
methods.description: Parses a string into a GuildMember object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: validateRole
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as a Role object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: parseRole
methods.description: Parses a string into a Role object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: validateChannel
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as a Channel object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: parseChannel
methods.description: Parses a string into a Channel object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: validateMessage
methods.description: Checks if a string can be interpreted as a Message object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

methods.name: parseMessage
methods.description: Parses a string into a Message object

params.name: msg
params.description: Message that the value is from

classes.name: CommandBuilder
classes.description: Builds commands with a fluent API

params.name: registry
params.description: The registry the command is for

methods.name: info
methods.description: Sets the command information.This must be used before any other method if info was not provided to the constructor.

methods.name: run
methods.description: Sets the command's run method

params.name: extras
params.description: Extra values to pass to the function

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Sets the command's hasPermission method

params.name: extras
params.description: Extra values to pass to the function

methods.name: register
methods.description: Registers the command

params.name: client
params.description: The client the group is for

params.name: guarded
params.description: Whether the group should be protected from disabling

params.name: commands
params.description: The commands that the group contains

props.name: client
props.description: Client that this group is for

props.name: id
props.description: ID of this group

props.name: name
props.description: Name of this group

props.name: commands
props.description: The commands in this group (added upon their registration)

props.name: guarded
props.description: Whether or not this group is protected from being disabled

methods.name: setEnabledIn
methods.description: Enables or disables the group in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to enable/disable the group in

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the group should be enabled or disabled

methods.name: isEnabledIn
methods.description: Checks if the group is enabled in a guild

returns.description: Whether or not the group is enabled

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads all of the group's commands

classes.name: CommandMessage
classes.description: A container for a message that triggers a command, that command, and methods to respond

params.name: patternMatches
params.description: Command pattern matches (if from a pattern trigger)

props.name: client
props.description: Client that the message was sent from

props.name: message
props.description: Message that triggers the command

props.name: command
props.description: Command that the message triggers, if any

props.name: argString
props.description: Argument string for the command

props.name: patternMatches
props.description: Pattern matches (if from a pattern trigger)

props.name: responses
props.description: Response messages sent, mapped by channel ID (set by the dispatcher after running the command)

props.name: responsePositions
props.description: The index of the current response that will be edited, mapped by channel ID

props.name: id
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.id`

props.name: content
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.content`

props.name: author
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.author`

props.name: channel
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.channel`

props.name: guild
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.guild`

props.name: member
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.member`

props.name: pinned
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.pinned`

props.name: tts
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.tts`

props.name: nonce
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.nonce`

props.name: system
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.system`

props.name: embeds
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.embeds`

props.name: attachments
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.attachments`

props.name: createdTimestamp
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.createdTimestamp`

props.name: createdAt
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.createdAt`

props.name: editedTimestamp
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.editedTimestamp`

props.name: editedAt
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.editedAt`

props.name: mentions
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.mentions`

props.name: cleanContent
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.cleanContent`

props.name: edits
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.edits`

props.name: editable
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.editable`

props.name: deletable
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.deletable`

props.name: pinnable
props.description: Shortcut to `this.message.pinnable`

methods.name: usage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for the message's command

params.name: argString
params.description: A string of arguments for the command

params.name: prefix
params.description: Prefix to use for theprefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: anyUsage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for any command

params.name: prefix
params.description: Prefix to use for theprefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: parseArgs
methods.description: Parses the argString into usable arguments, based on the argsType and argsCount of the command

methods.name: obtainArgs
methods.description: Obtains the values for the command's arguments

methods.name: run
methods.description: Runs the command

methods.name: throttleCommand
methods.description: Throttles the command if necessary (the owner is excluded)

methods.name: respond
methods.description: Responds to the command message

methods.name: editResponse
methods.description: Edits a response to the command message

methods.name: editCurrentResponse
methods.description: Edits the current response

params.name: id
params.description: The ID of the channel the response is in ("DM" for direct messages)

methods.name: say
methods.description: Responds with a plain message

methods.name: reply
methods.description: Responds with a reply message

methods.name: direct
methods.description: Responds with a direct message

methods.name: code
methods.description: Responds with a code message

methods.name: finalize
methods.description: Finalizes the command message by setting the responses and deleting any remaining prior ones

methods.name: deleteRemainingResponses
methods.description: Deletes any prior responses that haven't been updated

methods.name: isMentioned
methods.description: Shortcut to `this.message.isMentioned(data)`

params.name: data
params.description: A guild channel, user, or a role, or the ID of any of these

methods.name: edit
methods.description: Shortcut to `this.message.edit(content)`

methods.name: editCode
methods.description: Shortcut to `this.message.editCode(content)`

methods.name: pin
methods.description: Shortcut to `this.message.pin()`

methods.name: unpin
methods.description: Shortcut to `this.message.unpin()`

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Shortcut to `this.message.delete()`

params.name: timeout
params.description: How long to wait to delete the message in milliseconds

methods.name: parseArgs
methods.description: Parses an argument string into an array of arguments

params.name: argCount
params.description: The number of arguments to extract from the string

params.name: allowSingleQuote
params.description: Whether or not single quotes should be allowed to wrap arguments,in addition to double quotes

classes.name: Command
classes.description: A command that can be run in a client

params.name: client
params.description: The client the command is for

props.name: client
props.description: Client that this command is for

props.name: name
props.description: Name of this command

props.name: aliases
props.description: Aliases for this command

props.name: groupID
props.description: ID of the group the command belongs to

props.name: group
props.description: The group the command belongs to, assigned upon registration

props.name: memberName
props.description: Name of the command within the group

props.name: description
props.description: Short description of the command

props.name: format
props.description: Usage format string of the command

props.name: details
props.description: Long description of the command

props.name: examples
props.description: Example usage strings

props.name: guildOnly
props.description: Whether the command can only be run in a guild channel

props.name: defaultHandling
props.description: Whether the default command handling is enabled for the command

props.name: throttling
props.description: Options for throttling command usages

props.name: args
props.description: The arguments for the command

props.name: argsType
props.description: How the arguments are split when passed to the command's run method

props.name: argsCount
props.description: Maximum number of arguments that will be split

props.name: argsSingleQuotes
props.description: Whether single quotes are allowed to encapsulate an argument

props.name: patterns
props.description: Regular expression triggers

props.name: guarded
props.description: Whether the command is protected from being disabled

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.description: Checks a user's permission in a guild

methods.name: run
methods.description: Runs the command

params.name: message
params.description: The message the command is being run for

params.name: args
params.description: The arguments for the command, or the matches from a pattern.If args is specified on the command, thise will be the argument values object. If argsType is single, then onlyone string will be passed. If multiple, an array of strings will be passed. When fromPattern is true, this is thematches array from the pattern match(see {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/RegExp/exec}).

params.name: fromPattern
params.description: Whether or not the command is being run from a pattern match

methods.name: setEnabledIn
methods.description: Enables or disables the command in a guild

params.name: guild
params.description: Guild to enable/disable the command in

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the command should be enabled or disabled

methods.name: isEnabledIn
methods.description: Checks if the command is enabled in a guild

methods.name: isUsable
methods.description: Checks if the command is usable for a message

methods.name: usage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for the command

params.name: argString
params.description: A string of arguments for the command

params.name: prefix
params.description: Prefix to use for the prefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads the command

methods.name: unload
methods.description: Unloads the command

methods.name: usage
methods.description: Creates a usage string for a command

params.name: prefix
params.description: Prefix to use for the prefixed command format

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

classes.name: CommandDispatcher
classes.description: Handles parsing messages and running commands from them

props.name: client
props.description: Client this dispatcher handles messages for

props.name: registry
props.description: Registry this dispatcher uses

props.name: inhibitors
props.description: Functions that can block commands from running

methods.name: addInhibitor
methods.description: Adds an inhibitor
examples: client.dispatcher.addInhibitor(msg => {	if(!coolUsers.has(msg.author.id)) return ['cool', msg.reply('You\'re not cool enough!')];});

methods.name: removeInhibitor
methods.description: Removes an inhibitor

methods.name: handleMessage
methods.description: Handle a new message or a message update

params.name: oldMessage
params.description: The old message before the update

methods.name: inhibit
methods.description: Inhibits a command message

methods.name: cacheCommandMessage
methods.description: Caches a command message to be editable

methods.name: parseMessage
methods.description: Parses a message to find details about command usage in it

methods.name: matchDefault
methods.description: Matches a message against a guild command pattern

params.name: commandNameIndex
params.description: The index of the command name in the pattern matches

methods.name: buildCommandPattern
methods.description: Creates a regular expression to match the command prefix and name in a message

params.name: guild
params.description: The Guild that the message is from

classes.name: CommandRegistry
classes.description: Handles registration and searching of commands and groups

props.name: client
props.description: The client this registry is for

props.name: commands
props.description: Registered commands

props.name: groups
props.description: Registered command groups

props.name: evalObjects
props.description: Registered objects for the eval command

props.name: commandsPath
props.description: Fully resolved path to the bot's commands directory

methods.name: registerGroup
methods.description: Registers a single group

params.name: group
params.description: A CommandGroup instance, a constructor,an array of [ID, Name], or the group ID

params.name: name
params.description: name - Name for the group (if the first argument is the group ID)

methods.name: registerGroups
methods.description: Registers multiple groups

params.name: groups
params.description: An array of CommandGroup instances, constructors,or arrays of [ID, Name]

methods.name: registerCommand
methods.description: Registers a single command

params.name: command
params.description: Either a Command instance, or a constructor for one

methods.name: registerCommands
methods.description: Registers multiple commands

params.name: commands
params.description: An array of Command instances or constructors

methods.name: registerCommandsIn
methods.description: Registers all commands in a given directory. The files must export a Command class constructor or instance,or a CommandBuilder instance.

params.name: options
params.description: The path to the directory, or a require-all options object

methods.name: registerDefaults
methods.description: Registers both the default groups and commands

methods.name: registerDefaultGroups
methods.description: Registers the default groups

methods.name: registerDefaultCommands
methods.description: Registers the default commands to the bot's registry

params.name: options
params.description: Object specifying what commands to register

params.name: options.help
params.description: Whether or not to register the built-in help command

params.name: options.prefix
params.description: Whether or not to register the built-in prefix command

params.name: options.eval_
params.description: Whether or not to register the built-in eval command

params.name: options.ping
params.description: Whether or not to register the built-in ping command

params.name: options.commandState
params.description: Whether or not to register the built-in command state commands(enable, disable, reload, list groups)

methods.name: reregisterCommand
methods.description: Reregisters a command (does not support changing name, group, or memberName)

methods.name: unregisterCommand
methods.description: Unregisters a command

methods.name: registerEvalObject
methods.description: Registers a single object to be usable by the eval command

methods.name: registerEvalObjects
methods.description: Registers multiple objects to be usable by the eval command

methods.name: buildCommand
methods.description: Create a command builder

methods.name: findGroups
methods.description: Finds all groups that match the search string

params.name: exact
params.description: Whether the search should be exact

methods.name: resolveGroup
methods.description: Resolves a CommandGroupResolvable to a CommandGroup object

methods.name: findCommands
methods.description: Finds all commands that match the search string

params.name: exact
params.description: Whether the search should be exact

params.name: message
params.description: The message to check usability against

methods.name: resolveCommand
methods.description: Resolves a CommandResolvable to a Command object

classes.name: CommandFormatError
classes.description: Has a descriptive message for a command not having proper format

params.name: msg
params.description: The command message the error is for

classes.name: FriendlyError
classes.description: Has a message that can be considered user-friendly

interfaces.name: GuildExtension
interfaces.description: Additional methods added to Guild objects

props.name: commandPrefix
props.description: The command prefix in the guild - modifying this will emit {@link CommandoClient#commandPrefixChange}.

methods.name: setCommandEnabled
methods.description: Sets whether a command is enabled in the guild

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the command should be enabled

methods.name: isCommandEnabled
methods.description: Checks whether a command is enabled in the guild (does not take the command's group status into account)

methods.name: setGroupEnabled
methods.description: Sets whether a command group is enabled in the guild

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether the group should be enabled

methods.name: isGroupEnabled
methods.description: Checks whether a command group is enabled in the guild

methods.name: commandUsage
methods.description: Creates a command usage string using the guild's prefix

params.name: user
params.description: User to use for the mention command format

methods.name: applyToClass
methods.description: Applies the interface to a class prototype

params.name: target
params.description: The constructor function to apply to the prototype of

props.name: selfbot
props.description: Whether the command dispatcher should be in selfbot mode

props.name: commandPrefix
props.description: Default command prefix

props.name: commandEditableDuration
props.description: Time in seconds that command messages should be editable

props.name: nonCommandEditable
props.description: Whether messages without commands can be edited to a command

props.name: unknownCommandResponse
props.description: Whether the bot should respond to an unknown command

props.name: owner
props.description: ID of the bot owner's Discord user

props.name: invite
props.description: Invite URL to the bot's support server

props.name: key
props.description: Key for the argument

props.name: label
props.description: Label for the argument

props.name: prompt
props.description: First prompt for the argument when it wasn't specified

props.name: type
props.description: Type of the argument('string', 'integer', 'float', 'user', 'member', 'role', or 'channel')

props.name: max
props.description: If type is 'integer' or 'float', this is the maximum value of the number.If type is 'string', this is the maximum length of the string.

props.name: min
props.description: If type is 'integer' or 'float', this is the minimum value of the number.If type is 'string', this is the minimum length of the string.

props.name: default
props.description: Default value for the argument (makes the argument optional - cannot be `null`)

props.name: infinite
props.description: Whether the argument accepts infinite values

props.name: validate
props.description: Validator function for the argument

props.name: parse
props.description: Parser function for the argument

props.name: wait
props.description: How long to wait for input (in seconds)

typedefs.name: ArgumentValidator
typedefs.description: Function that validates an input value string

typedefs.name: ArgumentParser
typedefs.description: Function that parses an input value string into a proper value for the argument

props.name: run
props.description: The run function to set

props.name: hasPermission
props.description: The hasPermission function to set

props.name: usages
props.description: Maximum number of usages of the command allowed in the time frame.

props.name: duration
props.description: Amount of time to count the usages of the command within (in seconds).

props.name: name
props.description: The name of the command (must be lowercase)

props.name: aliases
props.description: Alternative names for the command (all must be lowercase)

props.name: autoAliases
props.description: Whether automatic aliases should be added

props.name: group
props.description: The ID of the group the command belongs to (must be lowercase)

props.name: memberName
props.description: The member name of the command in the group (must be lowercase)

props.name: description
props.description: A short description of the command

props.name: format
props.description: The command usage format string

props.name: details
props.description: A detailed description of the command and its functionality

props.name: examples
props.description: Usage examples of the command

props.name: guildOnly
props.description: Whether or not the command should only function in a guild channel

props.name: defaultHandling
props.description: Whether or not the default command handling should be used.If false, then only patterns will trigger the command.

props.name: throttling
props.description: Options for throttling usages of the command.

props.name: args
props.description: Arguments for the command.

props.name: argsType
props.description: One of 'single' or 'multiple'. Only applicable if `args` is not specified.When 'single', the entire argument string will be passed to run as one argument.When 'multiple', it will be passed as multiple arguments.

props.name: argsCount
props.description: The number of arguments to parse from the command string.Only applicable when argsType is 'multiple'. If nonzero, it should be at least 2.When this is 0, the command argument string will be split into as many arguments as it can be.When nonzero, it will be split into a maximum of this number of arguments.

props.name: argsSingleQuotes
props.description: Whether or not single quotes should be allowed to box-in argumentsin the command string.

props.name: patterns
props.description: Patterns to use for triggering the command

props.name: guarded
props.description: Whether the command should be protected from disabling

typedefs.name: Inhibitor
typedefs.description: A function that can block the usage of a command - these functions are passed the command message that istriggering the command. They should return `false` if the command should *not* be blocked. If the command *should*be blocked, they should return one of the following:- A single string identifying the reason the command is blocked- An array of the above string as element 0, and a response promise or `null` as element 1

typedefs.name: CommandGroupResolvable
typedefs.description: A CommandGroupResolvable can be:* A CommandGroup* A group ID

typedefs.name: CommandResolvable
typedefs.description: A CommandResolvable can be:* A Command* A command name* A CommandMessage

general.name: Welcome
general.content:
# discord.js Commando
[![Discord](https://discordapp.com/api/guilds/222078108977594368/embed.png)](https://discord.gg/bRCvFy9)
[![Downloads](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/discord.js-commando.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js-commando)
[![Version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/discord.js-commando.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/discord.js-commando)
[![Dependency status](https://david-dm.org/Gawdl3y/discord.js-commando.svg)](https://david-dm.org/Gawdl3y/discord.js-commando)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/npm/l/discord.js-commando.svg)](LICENSE)

This is the __**WIP**__ official command framework for [discord.js](https://github.com/hydrabolt/discord.js).
It makes full use of ES2017's `async`/`await`.

## Features
- Plain names and aliases
- Robust argument parsing (with "quoted strings" support)
- Regular expression triggers
- Multiple responses
- Command editing
- Command reloading
- Command throttling/cooldowns
- Automatic command argument prompting

## Installation
**Node 7.0.0 or newer is required.**  
`npm install --save discord.js-commando`

When running a bot using Commando, make sure to run Node with the `--harmony` flag. Examples:
- `node --harmony somebot.js`
- `pm2 start somebot.js --node-args='--harmony'`

## Documentation (WIP)
[View the docs here.](https://discord.js.org/#/docs/commando)  
See the [discord.js documentation](https://discord.js.org/#/docs) as well.
